description: Borrowed from Afrikaans apartheid (literally “separateness, apartness”) (1929 in a South African socio-political context), from Afrikaans apart (“separate”) + suffix -heid, cognate of English -hood.

entries.meaning: (South Africa, historical) The policy of racial separation used by South Africa from 1948 to 1990.
(by extension) Any similar policy of racial separation/segregation and discrimination, particularly when in favor of a minority rule.
examples: When the doors of a business are open to the public, they must be open to all regardless of race if apartheid is not to become engrained in our public  […] .

entries.meaning: (by extension) A policy or situation of segregation based on some specified attribute.

verbs.description: apartheid (third-person singular simple present apartheids, present participle apartheiding, simple past and past participle apartheided)

entries.meaning: To impose a policy of segregation of groups of people, especially one based on race.
